definition: to not say a word (idiom)/to keep silent

sentences.english: They said I looked like only injured the cat quiet, blissful silence only to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 她們說我象只安靜受傷的貓，不言不語只睡覺。

sentences.english: The old man looked meditatively at the darts board.
sentences.chinese: 老頭兒沉思不語，看着那投鏢板。

sentences.english: You must be thinking about your childhood.
sentences.chinese: 歸鄉的路上你深思不語，同鄉說你一定是想起童年了。

sentences.english: It wounded his dignity, and he locked himself up in silence.
sentences.chinese: 這傷害了他的自尊，於是他緘口不語了。

sentences.english: But I look like the good-for-nothing to be ordinary, at home shakes, keeps silent.
sentences.chinese: 而我則像行屍走肉一般，在家裏晃悠，不言不語。

sentences.english: I am quiet, she is humming, When the Stars Go Blue.
sentences.chinese: 我沉默不語，她時而嘆息，此刻繁星也變得愁悶。

sentences.english: The person is a vain statue. wear taciturnity calm.
sentences.chinese: 他是一座虛無的雕像，沉默不語。

sentences.english: The first monk smiled and asid nothing .
sentences.chinese: 第一個修道士仍然微笑不語。

sentences.english: Hear the report of Liang Liang Zhao Guibo mused.
sentences.chinese: 聽到鍾良的彙報趙貴波沉思不語。

sentences.english: He sat silently observing them for a few minutes.
sentences.chinese: 他默默不語地坐在那裏觀察他們好幾分鐘。

sentences.english: But, to the dilemma that the company faces, a lot of employee are tongueless not language.
sentences.chinese: 但是，對於公司面臨的困境，許多員工都緘默不語。

sentences.english: Do you speak up – or remain silent.
sentences.chinese: 你會大聲說出來爲他打抱不平，還是沉默不語？
卻任心事滿園，亦捻花不語。

sentences.english: The flowers not language, red dew wet coat.
sentences.chinese: 落花花不語，紅露溼人衣。

sentences.english: Even the Rafer haters are being silenced.
sentences.chinese: 即使是斯通黑也沉默不語了。

sentences.english: Jack Ferriman You okay? You seem quiet since you came back.
sentences.chinese: 傑克“你沒事吧？自從回來之後你就沉默不語。”

definition: to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
to bow the head/to yield/to give in
to remain silent/to have nothing to say/(coll.) speechless/dumbfounded
the world of mortals (Buddhism)/human society/worldly affairs
to gaze at/to fix one's eyes on
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
to fall and wither (like autumn leaves)/(fig.) drifting and homeless
